message: Does anyone have or know a good way of autocompleting a Linux directory/file using readline? I know it can handle the current directory and you can use chdir() to move it somewhere else but I'm getting annoyed at trying to make it browse my filesystem effectively.
Autocompleting in Python interpreter? Try iPython.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/187621/how-to-make-a-python-command-line-program-autocomplete-arbitrary-things-not-inte i guess you'll have to update autocompleter status by yourself. Check the source for of bpython for a hints.
It's for inside an application, so iPython won't work. But thanks.
@kura You can embed an IPython instance within an app.
